posts.title: CRUD
posts.author: Willy Musyoka
posts.content:
CRUD is an acronym that stands for Create, Read, Update, and Delete. These four operations are the fundamental functions for interacting with and managing data in almost any persistent storage system, such as databases, APIs, or even file systems.

C - Create: The ability to add new data records to a system. (e.g., adding a new user to a database, creating a new blog post).
R - Read (or Retrieve): The ability to access, view, or query existing data records from a system. (e.g., fetching a list of all users, displaying a specific blog post).
U - Update: The ability to modify existing data records in a system. (e.g., changing a user's email address, editing a blog post's content).
D - Delete: The ability to remove existing data records from a system. (e.g., deleting a user account, removing a blog post).
